repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.unittitle: Jody Jones Hunter Collection of Works by Anne Tyler
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Jody Jones Hunter Collection of Works by Anne Tyler, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Jody Jones Hunter Collection of Works by Anne Tyler was received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2001.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection is unprocessed: materials may not have been ordered and described beyond their original condition.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Hunter is a collector of works by certain southern authors taught by William Blackburn. Tyler is a Duke alumna and Pulitzer Prize-winning novelist and short story writer, whose best-known works include novels The Accidental Tourist (1985) and Breathing Lessons (1988).

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The collection consists primarily of first editions, limited editions, translations, and other editions (many of them autographed or inscribed, 1965-1998) of the works of Anne Tyler, delineating her prolific career. Also includes books about or containing contributions by Tyler (1958-1993); issues of periodicals containing her contributions or reviews of her work (1965-1996); and three pieces of her original correspondence (1979-1989).
